item.title: [PI] HyBriD PvP V2
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

NPC Command:

			if(playerCommand.startsWith("npc")) {
				try {
					int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.substring(4));
					if(newNPC > 0) {
						Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, newNPC, c.absX, c.absY, 0, 0, 120, 7, 70, 70, false, false);
						c.sendMessage("You spawn a Npc.");
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("No such NPC.");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					
				}			
			}

[hr]
Item Command:

			if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")) {
				try {
					String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
					if (args.length == 3) {
						int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
						int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
						if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
							c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);		
						} else {
							c.sendMessage("That item ID does not exist.");
						}
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					
				}
				}

[hr]
Master Command:

			if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("master")) {
					if (c.inWild())
					return;
				for (int i = 0; i < 21; i++) {
					c.playerLevel[i] = 99;
					c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
					c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);	
				}
				c.getPA().requestUpdates();
			}

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] HyBriD PvP V2
item.dc:creator: @sonic1576 sonic1576
item.description:
@sonic1576 wrote:

[quote=“owns reece, post:3, topic:396504”]Open your source files then search for commands.java.
open it then you will see loads of words. scroll down until you see
“if (playerCommand.startsWith(“name of command”)”
the name of the command is the part in brackets.
but really if u didnt know that then i suggest you dont try and code.[/quote] thanks :rolleyes:

Read full topic

Everyone starts from somewhere. You honestly can’t buy something new and know how to work it automatically. It takes time, learning, and a little bit of hands on work. Just give the kid a break and let him learn.[/quote]sounds fair.
